clinical_study.brief_title: Multicentre, Open Label, Randomized, Two-arm, Parallel-group Study to Assess Efficacy and Safety of ENVARSUS® Compared With Tacrolimus Used as Per Current Clinical Practice in the Initial Maintenance Setting in de Novo Kidney Transplant Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Multicentre, Open Label, Randomized, Two-arm, Parallel-group Study to Assess Efficacy and Safety of ENVARSUS® Compared With Tacrolimus Used as Per Current Clinical Practice in the Initial Maintenance Setting in de Novo Kidney Transplant Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to compare tacrolimus dosing of the new Envarsus®-based immunosuppressive regimen with current clinical practice (Prograf or Advagraf) over 6 months following de novo renal transplantation in a real-life setting in different European Countries.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a Multicentre, Open label, Randomized, Two-arm, parallel-group study to assess efficacy and safety of Envarsus® compared with tacrolimus used as per current clinical practice in the initial maintenance setting in de novo kidney transplant patients. The study will be conducted in approximately 10 european countries.

primary_outcome.measure: Tacrolimus total daily dose (TDD) from week 3 to month 6

arm_group.description: prolonged-release tablets once daily and orally
Prograf® hard capsules, twice daily, oral formulation or Advagraf® prolonged-release hard capsules, once daily, oral formulation

intervention.description: Envarsus® tablets, once daily, oral formulation. Prolonged -release formulation of tacrolimus
Prograf® hard capsules, twice daily, oral formulation
Advagraf® prolonged-release hard capsules, once daily, oral formulation
